Prom 2020 - A Time to Dance:
It's Finally Our Time To Dance! The 2020 Prom is upon us! And, while it will be non-traditional, it will be a time to remember.
Prom/Picnic will be held on Sunday, July 19, 2020, from 1:00 pm - 5:00 pm at the Hayloft. There will be a picnic lunch of buffalo chicken dip, pulled pork, macaroni & cheese, pasta salad, and fruit salad. There will be music, dancing, and picnic games, as well as the crowning of the prom court! Attendees can wear prom apparel or picnic apparel.
Tickets are $25 per person and are on sale 1 day only - Tuesday, June 23, 2020, from 3:00 pm - 5:00 pm in the high school lobby.
A minimum of 30 students must purchase tickets in order for the prom to be held. Any student wishing to attend from other schools must have a permission form. All school rules apply! If you have any questions, please email Mrs. Kretchman at akretchman@rockwoodschools.org.

The slideshow is also available to view on our District website.

We hope you enjoy the presentation. Again, CONGRATULATIONS scholar students on your academic success!!

RASD Class of 1965 donates to Rocket Fuel Backpack Food Program:

The RASD Class of 1965 recently made a generation donation of $2,100 to the Rocket Fuel Backpack Food Program. The program was originally developed to help feed children in the District and is currently participating weekly in the Food Distribution Program at the Rockwood School.

Two members from the “Class of 65”, Robert (Hank) Sembower and Clarke Romesberg, visited the District to present a check to the program and to lend a helping hand. Photos were taken by Merle Romesberg. Thank you “Class of 1965” for your generosity, especially during these difficult and uncertain times.

Following the start of the school day, the Rockwood Area School District received information of a specific credible threat of violence directed towards individuals in the District. The Pennsylvania State Police were immediately notified and the schools were placed on a “soft” external lockdown based upon information received. All external entrances were secured and internal student and staff routines continued as normal. Staff supervising students away from the school were notified of the threats, so that appropriate precautions could be taken. Once the District received notice from the Pennsylvania State Police the source of the threat was located and secured, the soft external lockdown was lifted and all District staff were notified. This matter remains under further investigation with the State Police. The identification of the involved individuals will remain confidential, and there is no further perceived threat to the District at this time.
